alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; Morrison (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 12:01PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing and Morrison Counties. Mississippi River at Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. St. Croix River at Danbury affecting Burnett and Pine Counties. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Fort Ripley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, This will cause minor flooding of rural areas near Fort Ripley. At 12.0 feet, The boat landing and parking lot at the public access are under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM CDT Saturday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 04/28/1975. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood . && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Mississippi River Fort Ripley 10.5 11.2 Sat 11 am CD 11.9 12.2 12.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1200 AM CDT.
